framed.io package¶

Submodules¶

framed.io.plaintext module¶

This module implements methods for reading and writing models using a plain text format.

Author: Daniel Machado

framed.io.plaintext.read_cbmodel_from_file(filename)¶

Reads a constraint-based model from a file.

Parameters:filename (str) – file path
Returns:constraint-based model
Return type:CBModel
framed.io.plaintext.read_model_from_file(filename, kind=None)¶

Reads a model from a file.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – file path
  • kind (str) – define kind of model to read (None or ‘cb’, optional)
Returns:

model (or respective subclass)
Return type:

Model
framed.io.plaintext.write_model_to_file(model, filename, print_instructions=True)¶

Writes a model to a file.

Parameters:
  • model (Model) – model (currently supports Model and CBModel)
  • filename (str) – file path
  • print_instructions (bool) – print plain text format instructions as header

framed.io.sbml module¶

This module implements methods for reading and writing SBML files.

Author: Daniel Machado

class framed.io.sbml.Flavor¶

Enumeration of available model flavors.

BIGG = 'bigg'¶
COBRA = 'cobra'¶
COBRA_OTHER = 'cobra:other'¶
FBC2 = 'fbc2'¶
SEED = 'seed'¶
framed.io.sbml.load_cbmodel(filename, flavor=None, exchange_detection_mode=None)¶
Parameters:
  • filename (str) – SBML file path
  • flavor (str) – adapt to different modeling conventions (optional, see Notes)
  • exchange_detection_mode (str) – detect exchange reactions (optional, see Notes)
Returns:

Simple model or respective subclass
Return type:

Model

Notes

Currently supported flavors:
  • ‘cobra’: UCSD models in the old cobra toolbox format
  • ‘cobra:other’: other models using the old cobra toolbox format
  • ‘seed’: modelSEED format
  • ‘bigg’: BiGG database format (uses sbml-fbc2)
  • ‘fbc2’: other models using sbml-fbc2
Supported exchange detection modes:
  • ‘unbalanced’: Exchange reactions is the one that have either only reactants or products
  • ‘boundary’: Exchange reaction is the one that have single boundary metabolite on one side
  • <regular expression pattern>: Regular expression which is executed against reaction ID

Note that some flavors (cobra, bigg) have their own exchange detection mode.

Returns:constraint-based model
Return type:CBModel
framed.io.sbml.load_odemodel(filename)¶
framed.io.sbml.load_sbml_model(filename, kind=None, flavor=None, exchange_detection_mode=None)¶

Loads a metabolic model from a file.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – SBML file path
  • kind (str) – define kind of model to load (‘cb’ or ‘ode’, optional)
  • flavor (str) – adapt to different modeling conventions (optional, see Notes)
  • exchange_detection_mode (str) – detect exchange reactions (optional, see Notes)
Returns:

Simple model or respective subclass
Return type:

Model

Notes

Currently supported flavors:
  • ‘cobra’: UCSD models in the old cobra toolbox format
  • ‘cobra:other’: other models using the old cobra toolbox format
  • ‘seed’: modelSEED format
  • ‘bigg’: BiGG database format (uses sbml-fbc2)
  • ‘fbc2’: other models using sbml-fbc2
Supported exchange detection modes:
  • ‘unbalanced’: Exchange reactions is the one that have either only reactants or products
  • ‘boundary’: Exchange reaction is the one that have single boundary metabolite on one side
  • <regular expression pattern>: Regular expression which is executed against reaction ID

Note that some flavors (cobra, bigg) have their own exchange detection mode.

framed.io.sbml.sanitize_id(identifier)¶
framed.io.sbml.save_cbmodel(model, filename, flavor='cobra')¶
framed.io.sbml.save_sbml_model(model, filename, flavor=None)¶

Save a model to an SBML file.

Parameters:
  • model (Model) – model
  • filename (str) – file path
  • flavor (str) – adapt to different modeling conventions (optional, currently available: ‘cobra’, ‘fbc2’)

Module contents¶

Package implementing all I/O methods for reading and writing models.

Currently supports SBML files and an in-house plain text format.

Author: Daniel Machado
